Articles.Content: Great, but no KerbalStuff?

Just wanted to let you guys know that I made some progress today with the HangarExtender.

I just need to find a few work arounds for some details and then everything should be fine.

Great!

10char

Update to the FSHangarExtender 3.4

Now with visual scaling of the buildings.

Download at Github

Pullrequest is sent to Snjo.

Update to the FSHangarExtender 3.4

Now with visual scaling of the buildings.

Download at Github

Pullrequest is sent to Snjo.

Coolness.

How did you figure out how to get the buildings to scale? Snjo said that he couldn't get that to work.

Coolness.

How did you figure out how to get the buildings to scale? Snjo said that he couldn't get that to work.

It was just a timing problem, the buildings get loaded last in the scene.

The real problem was that KSP itself does not bring any hooks or events when a scene is completly loaded and ready.

Update

Damn, Looks like there has sliped a bug through in the SPH.

Update to the FSHangarExtender 3.4.2

-Bugfix for the SPH

-Bugfix for building scaling and partplacement and camera

Download at Github

Edited September 5, 2015 by Alewx

Woo!

Requestion: Does this now have a way to set minimum zoom as well as maximum zoom? (And if not can you add that? )
Does anybody know how to make a craft recenter in the editor scene? preferrably centered along the horizontial axis.

Woo!

Requestion: Does this now have a way to set minimum zoom as well as maximum zoom? (And if not can you add that? )

I'm still facing some random NPEs, which is really annoying.

A minimum zoom, nope that is currently not included, but is for sure doable.

Which way would your minimum zoom be; with increased size the minimum zoom is also extended, or freely definable?

Does anybody know how to make a craft recenter in the editor scene? preferrably centered along the horizontial axis.

Detach the craft exepft for the first root part, and then remove that part, and add a new rootpart into the scene.

Update to the FSHangarExtender 3.4.3

- more bugfixing for Scene changes

Download at Github

Edited September 6, 2015 by Alewx

Just force-setting the min zoom to, say 0.01 (which worked well for RSS for years) when you change everything else. Right now it's very hard to zoom in enough when parts are small. But yeah, best to have it settable along with everything else.
How do you turn off the camera thing where if you rotate the camera so that its pointing down, it pivots you in an arc and down a little? I preferred it being off as I find it annoying

Just force-setting the min zoom to, say 0.01 (which worked well for RSS for years) when you change everything else. Right now it's very hard to zoom in enough when parts are small. But yeah, best to have it settable along with everything else.

Hmm will see what the current value is, but that should be very easy to do.

How do you turn off the camera thing where if you rotate the camera so that its pointing down, it pivots you in an arc and down a little? I preferred it being off as I find it annoying

Was that ever part of the mod? Sounds like you prefer the sph camera.
Thank you for updating this essential mod!

Hello,

I have downloaded this but I haven't got a numpad on my wireless keyboard so I changed the key to 'p' in the settings file. Nothing happens when I press it. I'm running KSP 64 in Ubuntu. I tried some other keys too but no joy. It's also not showing as loaded in AVC.

I tried running the game with the folder structure as downloaded, then also tried moving the dll only out of the FS.. folder and into the GameData. Nada.

Thanks!

Hello,

I have downloaded this but I haven't got a numpad on my wireless keyboard so I changed the key to 'p' in the settings file. Nothing happens when I press it. I'm running KSP 64 in Ubuntu. I tried some other keys too but no joy. It's also not showing as loaded in AVC.

I tried running the game with the folder structure as downloaded, then also tried moving the dll only out of the FS.. folder and into the GameData. Nada.

Thanks!

KSP: 1.0.4 (Unix) - Unity: 4.6.4f1 - OS: Linux 3.13 Ubuntu 14.04 64bit

[Very long list]

Thanks, I will look at it, but because you use Unix system, the filepath is used with a different separator, so he can not find the settings file. I will change that.

And AVC is not used by Hangarextender so it does not know about it.

Ah great! Thanks Alexw. I've just started using Civilian Population so that's why I'm trying hanger extended, it seems it is a very useful thing to have.

Thanks again and let me know if you need any more information or someone to test it for you in Linux.

Regards
Thanks!
So I checked out the configreading and the only real problem is the asterix itself(propably every other special letter also), it requires the brackets, every normal letter works without.
Is there a possibility to remove the hangar completely and build in open air?

Is there a possibility to remove the hangar completely and build in open air?

hmm yeah should be possible.
It would be great!

Update to the FSHangarExtender 3.4.4

  • added option to hide hangars in the editor
  • added option to enable advanced debugging (minature performance improvement / log clearance)
  • minimum zoom distance is increased by the scalingFactor

Download at Github

Wait...is there a way to *decrease* minimum zoom? That was my request... :]

(i.e. both larger maximum, and smaller minimum--RO involves 100+ meter tall craft, as well as tiny <0.25m diameter probes)

Wait...is there a way to *decrease* minimum zoom? That was my request... :]

(i.e. both larger maximum, and smaller minimum--RO involves 100+ meter tall craft, as well as tiny <0.25m diameter probes)

I haven't had a chance to test the new release yet, but this line looks like it does as you ask:


EditorBounds.Instance.cameraMinDistance /= scalingFactor;
Ah, I had read the post as implying multiplication. Rather than, y'know, checking the source. Thanks to you and thanks to Alewx
